mfm.fluorescence.tcspc.tcspc module¶

mfm.fluorescence.tcspc.tcspc.dnl_table(y, window_length, window_function, xmin, xmax)[source]¶

This function calculates a liberalization table for differential non-linearities given a measurement of uncorrelated light. The linearization table is smoothed to reduce the noise contained in the liberalization measurements. :return:

mfm.fluorescence.tcspc.tcspc.fconv[source]¶
Parameters:
  • decay – numpy-array the content of this array is overwritten by the y-values after convolution
  • lifetime_spectrum – vector of amplitdes and lifetimes in form: amplitude, lifetime
  • irf –
  • stop –
  • dt –
Returns:
mfm.fluorescence.tcspc.tcspc.fconv_per[source]¶
mfm.fluorescence.tcspc.tcspc.fconv_per_cs[source]¶
Parameters:
  • decay – array of doubles Here the convolved fit is stored
  • lifetime_spectrum – array of doubles Lifetime-spectrum of the form (amplitude, lifetime, amplitude, lifetime, ...)
  • irf – array-doubles The instrument response function
  • start – int Start channel of convolution (position in array of IRF)
  • stop – int Stop channel of convolution (position in array of IRF)
  • n_points – int Number of points in fit and lamp
  • period – double Period of repetition in nano-seconds
  • dt – double Channel-width in nano-seconds
  • conv_stop – int Stopping channel of convolution
mfm.fluorescence.tcspc.tcspc.get_scale_bg[source]¶

This function calculates a scaling factor for a given experimental histogram and model function. The scaling-factor scales the model function that the weighted photon counts agree

Parameters:
  • fit –
  • data –
  • data_weight –
  • bg –
  • start –
  • stop –
Returns:

scaling factor (float)
mfm.fluorescence.tcspc.tcspc.pddem[source]¶

Electronic Energy Transfer within Asymmetric Pairs of Fluorophores: Partial Donor-Donor Energy Migration (PDDEM) Stanislav Kalinin http://www.diva-portal.org/smash/get/diva2:143149/FULLTEXT01

Kalinin, S.V., Molotkovsky, J.G., and Johansson, L.B. Partial Donor-Donor Energy Migration (PDDEM) as a Fluorescence Spectroscopic Tool for Measuring Distances in Biomacromolecules. Spectrochim. Acta A, 58 (2002) 1087-1097.

-> same results as Stas pddem code (pddem_t.c)

Parameters:
  • decayA – decay A in form of [ampl lifetime, apml, lifetime...]
  • decayB – decay B in form of [ampl lifetime, apml, lifetime...]
  • k – rates of energy transfer [kAB, kBA]
  • px – probabilities of excitation (pxA, pxB)
  • pm – probabilities of emission (pmA, pmB)
  • pAB – pure AB [0., 0]
Returns:
mfm.fluorescence.tcspc.tcspc.pile_up[source]¶

Add pile up effect to model function. Attention: This changes the scaling of the model function.

Parameters:
  • rep_rate – float The repetition-rate in MHz
  • dead_time – float The dead-time of the system in nanoseconds
  • measurement_time – float The measurement time in seconds
  • data – numpy-array The array containing the experimental decay
  • model – numpy-array The array containing the model function

References

[R7]Coates, P.B., A fluorimetric attachment for an atomic-absorption spectrophotometer 1968 J. Phys. E: Sci. Instrum. 1 878
[R8]Walker, J.G., Iterative correction for pile-up in single-photon lifetime measurement 2002 Optics Comm. 201 271-277
mfm.fluorescence.tcspc.tcspc.rescale_w_bg[source]¶

Module contents¶

mfm.fluorescence.tcspc.fitrange(y, threshold=10.0, area=0.999)[source]¶

Determines the fitting range based on the total number of photons to be fitted (fitting area).

Parameters:
  • y – numpy-array a numpy array containing the photon counts
  • threshold – float a threshold value. Lowest index of the fitting range is the first encountered bin with a photon count higher than the threshold.
  • area – float The area which should be considered for fitting. Here 1.0 corresponds to all measured photons. 0.9 to 90% of the total measured photons.
Returns:
mfm.fluorescence.tcspc.weights(y)[source]¶

Calculated the weights used in TCSPC. Poissonian noise (sqrt of counts) :param y: numpy-array

the photon counts
Returns:numpy-array an weighting array for fittin
